subtitle: Strengthening Stakeholders Capacities to Contribute to the Implementation and Follow Up of the 2030 Agenda in Kenya
featureContent:
SDSN Kenya is a network that brings together universities, research centres, NGOs and other knowledge institutions with a focus on:

· Providing support to the implementation of the SDGs;

· Promoting practical Solutions Initiatives and long-term pathways for sustainable development;

· Promoting high-quality education and research collaboration for sustainable development;

· Supporting governments in understanding and addressing the challenges of sustainable development.

The overarching objective of network is to promote sustainable visions and solutions for long run development in Kenya.

The Network is hosted by the Center for Public Sector Reforms (CPSR), Moi University and Institute of Diplomacy and International Studies, University of Nairobi, both institutions domiciled in Kenya

Vision

Build pathways towards the achievement of the UN Sustainable Development Goals in Kenya by mobilizing research, outreach, and collective action.

Mission

Promote the implementation of solutions for sustainable development in Kenya.

Key objectives

• To mobilize SDSN Members in Kenya and coordinate the activities of SDSN Kenya

• To publicize national, regional and global SDSN activities among policy makers, private sector and civil society

• To promote national and regional solutions initiatives

• To coordinate and contribute to the SDSN’s policy support to County and National government in Kenya

• To organize annual regional sustainable development meetings bringing together key stakeholders from Kenya to identify and promote regional solutions initiatives
